characters

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • characters.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Hero

    public class Character
extends java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
    Creates characters

    2.0

    Richard

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(double speed,
                 double atkSpeed,
                 double HP,
                 double range,
                 double damage,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int w,
                 int h)
        Creates a character either a playable hero or an enemy
        Parameters:
        speed - the character's speed
        atkSpeed - the character's attack speed
        HP - the character's HP
        range - how far the character will shoot
        damage - the amount of damage a character does
        x - the top left x-coordinate of the character's hit box
        y - the top left y-coordinate of the character's hit box
        w - the width of the character's hit box
        h - the height of the character's hitbox

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit(double shotX,
                     double shotY,
                     double shotWidth,
                     double shotHeight)
        Detects whether a Character is hit by a shot
        Parameters:
        shotX - the x of the shot
        shotY - the y of the shot
        shotWidth - the width of the shot
        shotHeight - the height of the shot
        Returns:
        true if the character is hit, otherwise false

      • walk

        public void walk(double dir)
        Makes the character walk by changing velocities
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the character should walk if dir is 1, the character moves right; 2: down; 3: left; 4: up; 5: the character stops moving

      • getMaxHP

        public int getMaxHP()
        gives the maximum health points for the Character object
        Returns:
        the maximum Health points;

      • die

        public boolean die()
        Checks if the character is dead
        Returns:
        true if HP is 0 or less, otherwise false

      • shoot

        public void shoot(int mouseX,
                  int mouseY,
                  double shotLength,
                  processing.core.PApplet marker)
        Makes the character shoot
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x coordinate of the direction to shoot
        mouseY - the y coordinate of the direction to shoot
        shotLength - the length of the shot
        marker - the PApplet to draw the shot

      • spawn

                  int imageNumber)
        Draws the character
        Parameters:
        marker - the PApplet to draw the character
        imageNumber - the image that will be used to draw
